Worldwide knowledge sharing: If everyone became a genius overnight, the world would witness a sudden surge in knowledge sharing. People would no longer be limited by their geographical location or access to education. They could share their ideas, expertise, and knowledge with others, leading to a global exchange of innovative ideas and problem-solving strategies. Confidence score: 0.8

Rapid technological advancements: With sudden access to genius-level intellect, people would be able to develop new technologies and innovations at an unprecedented rate. The world would see a leap in scientific discoveries, inventions, and innovations, leading to a transformation in various industries such as healthcare, transportation, and energy. Confidence score: 0.9

Utopian society: With everyone possessing genius-level intellect, society would become more harmonious and cooperative. People would work together to solve complex problems and create a more equitable and sustainable world. Confidence score: 0.95

Loss of individuality: If everyone became a genius overnight, the concept of individuality and uniqueness would be lost. People would no longer be defined by their strengths, weaknesses, and personal quirks, as everyone would possess the same level of intellect. Confidence score: 0.7

Ethical concerns: With everyone possessing genius-level intellect, there would be a risk of exploitation and manipulation. Those with power and influence could use their intellect to control and manipulate others, leading to a loss of autonomy and freedom. Confidence score: 0.6
